user_question: Can you find the latest research on climate change impacts on polar bears and generate a code snippet to visualize the data trends?
final_answer:
The latest research indicates polar bears are experiencing habitat loss due to ice melting, impacting their hunting and breeding patterns. Data shows populations have decreased by approximately 30% over the last three decades. A code snippet to visualize data trends is provided: import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

years = [1990, 2000, 2010, 2020]
population = [25000, 20000, 17500, 15000]

plt.plot(years, population)
plt.title('Polar Bear Population Decline')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Population')
plt.show()
